availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. Rake (Franklin County and Anderson County, Kentucky, cabinet maker.)

body.p: Franklin County and Anderson County, Kentucky, cabinet maker. Native of England. Married Father of Catherine Rake, Mary Rake, Elizabeth Rake, John D. Rake, Hannah Rake, William Rake, Neston Rake, Alice Rake, Agnes Rake, and James S. Rake. Married Elizabeth Malear Rake in Anderson County in November 1863. Stepfather of James Malear. Cabinet maker in Franklin County in 1850. Employed William Settle as an apprentice mechanic in Franklin County in 1850. Worked with Albert Hales as a cabinet maker in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort City, p. 332..
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, pp. 54A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 414.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 139B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Anderson County Marriages, Film #001550673, p. 1205.
